questions.title: What is Data Science?
questions.prompt: Explain what data science is in simple terms and how it differs from related fields like statistics or computer science.
followups: What are the main stages of a typical data science project?
How does data science create business value?

questions.title: Supervised vs Unsupervised Learning
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between supervised and unsupervised machine learning.
followups: Give an example of each type of learning
What is reinforcement learning and how does it differ from these two?

questions.title: Basic Data Types
questions.prompt: What are the main types of data (numerical, categorical, etc.) and how would you handle each type differently?
followups: What's the difference between nominal and ordinal categorical data?
How would you handle missing values in different data types?

questions.title: Mean, Median, Mode
questions.prompt: Explain when you would use mean, median, or mode to describe a dataset and why.
followups: In what situations is median better than mean?
What does the mode tell you about a distribution?

questions.title: What is Overfitting?
questions.prompt: Explain what overfitting is in machine learning and why it's a problem.
followups: How can you detect overfitting?
What are some basic ways to prevent it?

questions.title: Correlation vs Causation
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between correlation and causation with an example.
followups: Why is correlation not enough to prove causation?
What methods can help establish causality?

questions.title: Regression vs Classification
questions.prompt: What's the difference between regression and classification problems?
followups: Give an example of each type of problem
Can some algorithms handle both types of problems?

questions.title: What is a Feature?
questions.prompt: Explain what features are in machine learning and why feature selection is important.
followups: What makes a good feature?
What is feature engineering?

questions.title: Training and Test Sets
questions.prompt: Why do we split data into training and test sets?
followups: What is a typical split ratio?
What happens if we don't use a test set?

questions.title: What is a Hypothesis?
questions.prompt: In the context of A/B testing, what is a hypothesis and how do you formulate one?
followups: What's the difference between null and alternative hypotheses?
How do you determine if results are statistically significant?

questions.title: Data Visualization Purpose
questions.prompt: Why is data visualization important in data science?
followups: What are some common types of charts and when would you use each?
How does visualization help in exploratory data analysis?

questions.title: Accuracy Metric
questions.prompt: What is accuracy as a metric and when is it appropriate to use?
followups: When might accuracy be misleading?
What are some alternatives to accuracy?

questions.title: Bias-Variance Tradeoff
questions.prompt: Explain the bias-variance tradeoff in simple terms.
followups: What does high bias indicate about a model?
What does high variance indicate?

questions.title: What is Big Data?
questions.prompt: Explain what big data is and the three Vs that characterize it.
followups: What are some challenges of working with big data?
How does big data differ from traditional data analysis?

questions.title: SQL Basics
questions.prompt: Why is SQL important for data scientists and what are some basic SQL operations?
followups: What's the difference between WHERE and HAVING clauses?
How do JOIN operations work?
